alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 2:44PM EST until December 22 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills with wind gusts greater than 45 mph possible. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Northwest Pocahontas and Southeast Randolph Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 AM to 1 PM EST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.
